radiographic_examinations.findings: Interval increase in the size of pancreatic cysts: cyst in neck measures 24 x 30 mm (previously 17 x 25 mm); cyst in tail measures 25 x 27 mm (previously 16 x 14 mm). Dilated main pancreatic duct contains non-enhancing filling defects, consistent with multiple stones. Edema within the anterior pararenal space; no fluid collection or pseudoaneurysm detected. Liver has no enhancing lesion; dilatation of left biliary system unchanged. Stent noted in common bile duct, mild enhancement of wall present, gallbladder normal. Possible partial thrombus beyond celiac axis. Multiple non-pathologically enlarged nodes in the peripancreatic region.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Cysts have increased in size compared to prior study; specific measurements provided.
